alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 07 at 1:51PM CDT until October 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE REMAINDER OF SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY AFTERNOON... The combination of breezy post-frontal northwesterly winds, critically low humidities, and very dry fuels with ongoing drought conditions will make for dangerous fire weather conditions the remainder of Saturday afternoon. For Sunday, very dry fuels and critically low humidities will maintain an elevated fire weather threat. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHEAST ALABAMA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR DRY FUELS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHEAST ALABAMA... The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 7 PM CDT Sunday. * AFFECTED AREA...Coffee, Dale, Henry, Geneva and Houston. * WIND...For the rest of today, northwest around 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. For Sunday, north 10 to 15 mph. * HUMIDITY...For the rest of today, 20 to 24 percent. For Sunday, as low as 20 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
